definition: of no consequence (idiom)

sentences.english: Yes, yesterday was the my pay-day; I pay you the payment today.
sentences.chinese: 是地，昨天是咋噠發薪日，俺今天付給你報酬。

sentences.english: At first glance, students' fears also seem warranted.
sentences.chinese: 咋一看，學生們的擔心也是對的。

sentences.english: Liang Xin, you say we this how do one million consumption.
sentences.chinese: 良欣，你說咱這一百萬咋消費了。

sentences.english: How do we assess the value?
sentences.chinese: 我們咋評估這些價值呢？

sentences.english: To which the mugger responded, "Duh, do you think I grabbed you for your looks?"
sentences.chinese: 劫匪回答“咋，你還以爲我是要劫色嗎？”

sentences.english: I started my career from last summer.
sentences.chinese: 我到年夏天開始了我的職業生涯“咋說？

sentences.english: In our school, there is little girl likes playing football.
sentences.chinese: “在我們學校很少有女孩子喜歡踢足球”英語咋說？

sentences.english: The Japanese understand that. Why don’t we?
sentences.chinese: 小日本都懂，咱們咋就不懂嘞？

sentences.english: Jon Zug is aproceecutorprosecutor in Albemarle County, where the university is located.
sentences.chinese: 喬恩咋克是學校所坐落的阿爾伯馬爾縣的檢察官。

sentences.english: It was only the yogurt or cultured milk products with lactic acid bacteria.
sentences.chinese: 就係得酸奶酪同酸奶製品有乳酸菌架咋。

sentences.english: Why are there always no gifts in my stockings hanging outside.
sentences.chinese: 襪子掛在外面老收不到聖誕老人的禮物咋回事？

sentences.english: Please, please, can't you give us some help?
sentences.chinese: 你咋不能就給我們個方子呢？

sentences.english: This is the Editor's Note Son.
Been good, but these days not to step on Baidu, Editor's Note?
sentences.chinese: 一直都很好，但是這兩天百度不來踩了，咋回事？

sentences.english: Think he looks a bit dejected, can not help but ask him Zehui Shi.
sentences.chinese: 看他神色有點黯然，不禁問他咋回事。

sentences.english: Why do you seize the land of Guyana in South American still?
sentences.chinese: 你咋還在南美佔著人家圭亞那呢？

definition: dialectal equivalent of 為什麼|为什么[wei4 shen2 me5]
variant of 怎麼|怎么[zen3 me5]
dialectal equivalent of 什麼|什么[shen2 me5]/also pr. [sha4]
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
what?/how?/how about?/whatever/also pr. [zen3 me5 zhe5]

suffix, used to form interrogative 什麼|什么[shen2 me5], what?, indefinite 這麼|这么[zhe4 me5] thus, etc
tiny/insignificant
variant of 咱[zan2]
what are you doing?/whatever for?/why on earth?
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
interjection of surprise/Ah!/Oh!
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
(particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
I (northern dialects)
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
hey (to call sb)
hey (to express agreement)
hey (to express disagreement)
hey (to express surprise)
sigh (to express regret)
modal particle indicating indicating lack of enthusiasm/modal particle indicating that things should only or can only be done a certain way

battle cry
